The approach reflects economic, social, environmental, biomedical and other relevant factors that influence health.
2  A systematized review attempts to include elements of a systematic review process, while coming short of a full systematic review.  
A systematized review is typically narrative, exploring what is known together with the uncertainties around the findings [33].
